instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
threads.message:
Hello, 
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged, one USB-C port have 5v 0.3a-0.5a
The other one 5v0 0a
How i could start the diagnostic in this case.
Thanks for your help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings between <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips; even better if have a good board for comparison.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
threads.message: I Found <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> Shorted with 6.7 when i tried to connect the charger voltage in this line was unstable between 0 and max value was 0.6 V also <SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPDDR_SOC</SIGNAL> was shorted too was 0.3, can it be the T2 chip? and is there anyway i can fix this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
threads.message:
"I Found <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> Shorted with 6.7"
What means 6.7?
Post exact ohm value to ground, not diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damaged
threads.message:
These are really bad values.
You can try to inject 1V to <SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPDDR_SOC</SIGNAL> .
If T2 heats, the board is good for scrap...
